com.philbeaudoin.gwt.presenter.client.proxy
Interface PlaceManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
PlaceManagerImpl, PuzzlebazarPlaceManager
public interface PlaceManager

Place managers work as an intermediary between the GWT History API and ProxyPlaceImpls. It sets up event listener relationships to synchronize them.

Author:
David Peterson

Method Summary

Method Detail

revealCurrentPlace

void revealCurrentPlace()
Reveals the place corresponding to the current value of the history token in the URL bar. This will result in a PlaceRequestEvent being fired.

revealDefaultPlace

void revealDefaultPlace()
Reveals the default place. This is invoked when the history token is empty and no places handled it. Application-specific place managers should fire the PlaceRequestEvent corresponding to their default place.

revealErrorPlace

void revealErrorPlace(java.lang.String invalidHistoryToken)
Reveals an error place. This is invoked when the history token was not handled by any place within the application. Application-specific place managers should fire the PlaceRequestEvent corresponding to a place that displays an error. The default implementation is simply to call revealDefaultPlace().

Parameters:
invalidHistoryToken - The history token that was not recognised.

setOnLeaveConfirmation

void setOnLeaveConfirmation(java.lang.String question)
Sets the question that will be displayed whenever the user tries to navigate away from the current page. Navigating away can happen either occur by changing the program state (the history token), by entering an external URL or by closing the window. All cases will be handled.

If the user indicates that he doesn't accept the navigation, then the navigation will be cancelled and the current page will remain.

Parameters:
question - The question to display. Pass null to accept navigation directly, without asking a question.

confirmLeaveState

boolean confirmLeaveState()
Important: Do not call directly from outside the presenter package. If a confirmation question is set (see setOnLeaveConfirmation, this asks the user if he wants to leave the current page.

Returns:
true if the user accepts to leave. false if he refuses.

onPlaceChanged

void onPlaceChanged(PlaceRequest placeRequest)
Called whenever the current place has changed in a way that requires history parameters to be modified.

Parameters:
placeRequest - The PlaceRequest portraying the change.

onPlaceRevealed

void onPlaceRevealed(PlaceRequest placeRequest)
Called whenever a new place has been revealed.

Parameters:
placeRequest - The PlaceRequest for the place that has just been revealed.
